programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Reading/WHU '07
programme.desc: Reading: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Reading, the 6-0 hammering of West Ham at the Madejski Stadium in 2007.

programme.title: PL Greatest:Sheff Utd/Arsenal 2006
programme.desc: Sheff Utd: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. For Sheffield United, the 1-0 win over Arsenal at Bramall Lane in December 2006.

programme.title: PL Greatest: Sheff Weds/Man U 1998
programme.desc: Sheff Wed: Enjoy the greatest Premier League game for each of the league's 47 clubs, as voted for by fans. Here, for Sheffield Wednesday, the 3-1 win over Man Utd back in November 1998.

programme.title: The Greatest Leg - 2023 Final
programme.desc: In 2023, both MVG and Michael Smith were on course to record a nine-dart leg; the Dutchman fell short by a single dart, but the Englishman achieved perfection. Ep 10.

programme.title: 30 Years of the PDC World Champs'
programme.desc: In celebration of 30 years of the PDC World Darts Championship, take a look back at the very first tournament, a classic final from 2007 and one of the greatest legs ever played. Ep 1.

programme.title: The Taylor Years
programme.desc: Hear from the legendary Phil Taylor as the 16-time world champion recounts his glory years at the PDC World Darts Championship. Ep 2.

programme.title: The Greatest Final 07:Taylor v RVB
programme.desc: In the final act at the Circus Tavern, two of the finest players to have ever played the sport created a match for the ages, as Phil Taylor and Raymond van Barneveld met in the final. Ep 3.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: Aston Villa v N. Forest
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Aston Villa host Nottingham Forest at Villa Park in an enthralling, end-to-end encounter that saw 10 goals.

programme.title: EFL 18/19: Aston Villa v Leeds Utd
programme.desc: In the dying embers of an 2018-19 Sky Bet Championship clash at Villa Park, Kemar Roofe's last-gasp goal sealed a famous Leeds comeback having trailed 2-0 to Aston Villa.

programme.title: EFL 18/19: Aston Villa v Sheff Utd
programme.desc: In 2019 at Villa Park, Tyrone Mings, Tammy Abraham and Andre Green saved Villa's blushes, scoring three goals in the final 10 minutes to steal a point from the visiting Sheffield United.

programme.title: EFL 18/19:Leeds Utd v Derby County
programme.desc: Frank Lampard's Derby go to Elland Road for the second leg of their 2018-19 Sky Bet Championship play-off semi-final with Marcelo Bielsa's Leeds, with the odds stacked against them.

programme.title: Nick Dougherty's Tee Time Tips
programme.desc: As winter takes its grip, hear from former professional Nick Dougherty as he shares his Tee Time Tips to help you improve your game out on the golf course.

programme.title: Best of The OpenZone 2024
programme.desc: A look at the best moments from The Open Zone during 2024.

programme.title: EFL 18/19: Charlton v Doncaster
programme.desc: Two matches of Sky Bet League 1 semi-final play-off action couldn't separate Charlton Athletic and Doncaster Rovers in 2019, as a date at Wembley hinged on a dramatic penalty shootout.

programme.title: EFL 21/22: Coventry City v Fulham
programme.desc: In October 2021, Coventry took Fulham to the sword, putting four past the travelling west Londoners who eventually went on to secure Premier League promotion.

programme.title: EFL 21/22: Blackburn v Fulham
programme.desc: In a Sky Bet Championship encounter to remember for the visitors - and one to forget for the hosts - the travelling Fulham put seven unanswered goals past a hapless Blackburn at Ewood Park.

programme.title: EFL Play-Off Memories: 1999
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic play-off final from the English Football League. Here, rewind to 1999 and a memorable encounter between Gillingham and Manchester City.

programme.title: US F1 GP: Sprint

programme.title: ICC Women's ODI WC: SL v BAN
programme.desc: It's a must-win contest in Navi Mumbai for both Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. With just two points apiece, the loser here will be knocked out of contention for the semi-finals. (20.10)

programme.title: ICC Women's ODI WC: SA v PAK
programme.desc: Assured of their semi-final spot at the Women's Cricket World Cup, South Africa face a winless Pakistan side still in contention as Fatima Sana and co require a big result here. (21.10)

programme.title: WTA Final: Ningbo
programme.desc: Out to strengthen her bid to reach the WTA Finals, Elena Rybakina targets WTA 500 glory in the Ningbo final as the world number nine meets fellow top-10 star Ekaterina Alexandrova. (19.10)

programme.title: ATP Final: Almaty
programme.desc: Daniil Medvedev competes in the Almaty title match, his 40th tour-level final, as the former world number one meets Corentin Moutet in what will be the his third ATP Tour final. (19.10)

programme.title: Mexicco City F1 GP Highlights 2023

programme.desc: It's a must-win contest in Navi Mumbai for both Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. With just two points apiece, the loser here will be knocked out of contention for the semi-finals. (20.10)

programme.desc: The Proton Transmogrification: Sheldon struggles to process his feelings of grief when his idol Professor Proton passes away. The gang gather to celebrate Star Wars Day.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Send Out the Clowns: The funeral service for a beloved clown mentor reunites Cameron with his estranged ex-clown partner, Lewis. And Manny has a cool new friend.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Leap Day: Cameron's birthday falls on 29 February, and with the celebrations coming but once every four years, there's loads of pressure on Mitchell to get it right.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Birthday Synchronicity: Sheldon and Amy try to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home but are interrupted when Bernadette goes into labour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Holiday Summation: After spending Christmas apart, the gang gather at Penny and Leonard's flat and hear about Sheldon and Amy's terrible trip to Texas.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Romance Recalibration: Penny thinks that Leonard has stopped making an effort in their relationship, so she decides to go away for a spa weekend with Amy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Emotion Detection Automation: Sheldon tests a new invention after hearing that it could help him to read people's emotions. Raj seeks dating advice.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Bimbo: Holt and Peralta investigate when valuable antique coins are stolen from the university where Kevin works. Jeffords and Santiago get competitive.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Ticking Clocks: Peralta and the squad track down a hacker who infiltrates the precinct's servers, compromising protected information on undercover agents.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Is Where the Art Isn't: Homer learns to love a Miro painting. Then it's stolen - and he gets the blame.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: King Leer: Moe inherits a mattress business from his father, then lands in an all-out war with his siblings.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: At another emotionally charged Commitment Ceremony, one couple affirm their love, a bride's behaviour is called out and there's solo sofa surfing... again.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: More clips from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, including a zombie prank, cats singing the Star Wars theme, a hilarious pee prank and an escaped honey badger.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tesla Recoil: Leonard and Howard learn that Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Bernadette thinks Ruchi's trying to steal her job.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Mook, the Chef, the Wife and Her Homer: Homer becomes the boss of Fat Tony's mob when Tony's son decides to become a chef rather than go into the family business.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Jazzy and the Pussycats: Bart takes up playing the drums, upstages Lisa and joins a top jazz band. So Lisa turns her back on music and starts rescuing animals instead.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: After Clare's deadly scheme, a resident's hunt for answers takes them to Brookside Close, where they're met by someone who's not afraid to speak her mind: Sheila Grant.

programme.title: New: Hollyoaks Unwrapped
programme.desc: Brand new series: Alex Fletcher, Tisha Merry, Gemma Bissix, Charlie Wernham and Gary Lucy join Kieron Richardson for a deep dive into the world of Hollyoaks as it celebrates 30 years. (Ep4)

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's rural retreat time, and a welcome romantic break for some. But rumours about a bride's behaviour spiral, and another bride learns a heartbreaking truth.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics have been watching The Masked Singer, Trigger Point, Pam & Tommy, First Dates: Valentine's, Mary Beard's Forgotten Art, and Dragons' Den.

programme.title: New: Hollyoaks Later
programme.desc: Brand new: Hollyoaks Later collides with Brookside as residents escape the Close for Liverpool's luxury suburbs, where old secrets ignite new betrayals when a party turns deadly.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Can meat-loving teacher Marie control her sledgehammer wit when she finds out that her date Davin is a vegan? Sexagenarians Lynda and Philip both like younger men. DJ Tom is back.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's rural retreat time, and a welcome romantic break for some. But rumours about a bride's behaviour spiral, and another bride learns a heartbreaking truth.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Later

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: Much Ado About Crushing: The fight for Chase's affection heats up. And the drama bubbles over as a wild night out in a hot tub ends with an unexpected bang.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart After Dark: Bart gets a job at a burlesque theatre. Several residents are keen customers, but others aren't happy to have the showgirls peddling their wares in Springfield.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: It's the Great Pumpkin, Phil Dunphy: Phil and Claire want to celebrate Halloween in a big way, but no one else seems to share their enthusiasm for it.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Geology Methodology: Sheldon and Bert collaborate on a research project, but Sheldon feels embarrassed to be associated with the study of geology.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bitcoin Entanglement: Sheldon seeks revenge when the guys cut him out of a potentially valuable investment. A secret about Leonard and Penny is revealed.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Confidence Erosion: Sheldon and Amy try to use maths to make their wedding planning less stressful. Raj falls out with Howard.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Climb: Gemma decides to fire a teacher but isn't prepared for the aftermath. Calvin gets a surprise when he faces off with his paper boy.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Basketball!: Phil's been doing basketball training so that he can redeem himself at the annual charity game. Then NBA stars Charles Barkley and DeAndre Jordan turn up...

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Pig Moon Rising: Mitchell accidentally knocks over an urn filled with Cam's beloved pet pig Lilly's ashes. Can he cover up his blunder?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Michon's: Can Gordon help the unwell owner of a family-run Atlanta smokehouse address his daughter's hands-off management style?

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's rural retreat time, and a welcome romantic break for some. But rumours about a bride's behaviour spiral, and another bride learns a heartbreaking truth.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Last Tap Dance in Springfield: Lisa takes up dancing but discovers that she's not very good at it. Bart and Milhouse duck out of their camping trip and hide out in the mall.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge: Otto's rock 'n' roll marriage to his girlfriend Becky (Parker Posey) is over as soon as it's begun. So Becky moves in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gorilla Dissolution: Penny re-evaluates her life, including taking a big step with Leonard, while Howard and Bernadette struggle to look after Mrs Wolowitz.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Status Quo Combustion: With potential changes affecting different aspects of his personal and professional life, Sheldon is forced to confront an uncertain future.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Last Walt: Claire supports Luke when his friend Walt dies. Phil takes Alex for some father-daughter bonding time, and Haley throws an unauthorised party.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Planes, Trains & Cars: The Dunphys want a new car and Phil makes a spontaneous purchase without Claire. Jay is determined to sort his high school reunion with Gloria and Manny.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotion Reverberation: Leonard and Howard distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows their progress on the guidance system.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Allowance Evaporation: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic-Con Conundrum: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj appoints Sheldon to organise his finances. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Escape Hatch Identification: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj when he's forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Cinco de Mayo: When Jeffords becomes anxious about his upcoming lieutenant's exam, the squad hold the precinct's annual Halloween Heist on a new date.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Sicko: Peralta and Boyle investigate a serial killer. Holt spars with his rival, Commissioner Kelly. Jeffords deals with complications after his recent exam.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa Gets the Blues: Lisa gets the yips and Bart is made to dress up and sing as Annie from the musical. They go to New Orleans to recover.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Forgive and Regret: Grampa, thinking he's about to die, reveals a terrible secret. Can Homer forgive him?

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's rural retreat time, and a welcome romantic break for some. But rumours about a bride's behaviour spiral, and another bride learns a heartbreaking truth.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Celebration Reverberation: Sheldon and Howard plan birthday celebrations for Amy and Halley. Leonard is stressed by a Christmas letter from his brother.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Matrimonial Metric: Sheldon and Amy secretly test their friends, to work out who should be best man and maid of honour at their wedding.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Please Homer Don't Hammer 'Em: Marge discovers that she has a gift for carpentry, but has to use Homer as a cover in order to overcome prejudices against women builders.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror XVII: Homer ingests a blob from an asteroid; Bart enslaves a clay monster; and everyone thinks that aliens are invading.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Waverly Hills, 9-0-2-1-D'oh: The family rent a flat in the affluent Waverly Hills area so that Bart and Lisa can get into a good school.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: I Won't Be Home for Christmas: When Moe convinces Homer to stay out late on Christmas Eve, Marge kicks him out of the house and he has to spend Christmas alone.

programme.title: Supercruising: Life at Sea
programme.desc: The team sailing the Americas traverse the Panama Canal while passengers enjoy showstopping cakes. And in Europe, cruisers go whale watching near Tenerife. (Ep3)

programme.title: Gogglebox 2021
programme.desc: What do Britain's favourite TV viewers think of 2021's biggest shows, from Squid Game to Strictly and Line of Duty? Including the Siddiqui family, Giles and Mary, and Jenny and Lee.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ruby's only ever had dates with 'bad boys'; how will she react when Kriss reveals his sensitive side? And will young-at-heart octogenarians Patricia and Alan find love?

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Pansexual Sarah can't wait to road test her new body on her first date as a woman. Plumber Jamie's love life has gone down the u-bend, so he's all cisterns go to find a partner.

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: Fraught Mess: A group of friends hop onboard looking for luxury. But will they get it? Chef Cloyce struggles with a seven-course dinner and difficult diners.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Open House of Horrors: The neighbours don't share Clare's enthusiasm for Halloween, so this year she has to tone it down a bit. And Mitch and Cam host a costume party.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpsoncalifragilisticexpiala (Annoyed Grunt) cious: Supernanny Shary Bobbins comes to the rescue of Marge, who is so stressed that her hair has started to fall out.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Solo Oscillation: Amy and Leonard bond over some experiments. Bert replaces Howard in his band. Penny gives Sheldon unexpected scientific inspiration.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Separation Triangulation: Raj gets into a domestic drama with his new date Nell and her estranged husband. Sheldon rents his old room back from Leonard.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to Logan #2: When Calvin and Dave's college basketball teams face off, Dave surprises the Butlers with tickets and also invites one of his friends.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Camping Trip: When the Johnsons invite the Butlers to go camping, Dave is taken aback by Calvin's idea of roughing it.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Repass: The Butlers host a memorial when a curmudgeonly neighbour passes away. And Calvin learns something unexpected about himself.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Conversation: Dave's thrilled when Calvin invites him golfing. But does Calvin have an ulterior motive?

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Five Minutes: Mitch and Cam have five minutes to catch a flight, and Haley and Rainer are forced to re-evaluate their entire relationship in five minutes.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Frank's Wedding: Frank Dunphy's Roaring Twenties-themed wedding day is finally here, and to get into the spirit, Phil gets the Dunphy clan to show up in costume.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip featuring animals and food, from the always hilarious Tube that is Rude.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Zocalo: Gordon Ramsay visits a floundering Mexican restaurant which has become an albatross around the necks of its owners, married couple Greg and Mary Russell.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spin a Yarn: Gordon tries to save the struggling Spin a Yarn restaurant in California. Despite an expensive refurbishment, the business is tearing apart its owners' marriage.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Behind the Laughter: A behind-the-scenes look at the Simpson family. How did they win their fame? And how did they cope when the showbiz pressure got too much?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Springfield Splendor: Lisa and Marge team up on a graphic novel that becomes a musical. But Marge takes all the credit...

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Locomotion Interruption: Leonard and Amy take an impromptu road trip to Arizona to pick up Sheldon when his epic railway journey ends in chaos. Penny has an interview.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Junior Professor Solution: When Sheldon has to teach a course at the university, Howard enrols in his class. Tension brews between Penny and Bernadette.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Disneyland: Nothing is more quintessential to good old family fun than a trip to Disneyland - but not without a side of motion sickness, achy feet and a wayward toddler.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Tableau Vivant: Jay and Gloria get on each other's nerves while trying to order lunch, and Cam and Claire can't agree on how to discipline children.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Fluctuation: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, and Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's professional life.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Recollection Dissipation: Sheldon collaborates on two projects - one with Leonard and Howard, plus another with Amy - pushing himself to the limit.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Separation Agitation: Howard and Bernadette are upset when they leave Halley at the nursery. Bert the geologist introduces his girlfriend to the gang.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cognition Regeneration: Leonard isn't happy when he finds out that Penny is considering accepting a job offer from her ex-boyfriend Zack.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Suicide Squad: Desperate circumstances call for desperate measures as Peralta, Captain Holt and the team are forced to ally themselves with some old enemies.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Manhunter: Jake leads a manhunt after an assassination attempt is made on a city councillor. Holt adjusts to his new position as a uniformed officer.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Left Behind: Flanders loses his job and comes to work with Homer at the power plant. Homer prays for him to be fired.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Throw Grampa from the Dane: The Simpsons visit Denmark and all fall in love with it - except Homer. Meanwhile, Grampa needs a serious operation.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Novelization Correlation: Amy appears on the Professor Proton show. Penny hates the idea that the female protagonist in Leonard's novel is based on her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Neonatal Nomenclature: Bernadette's friends try various tactics to help her go into labour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Athenaeum Allocation: Leonard jumps through hoops to secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy. Howard and Bernadette face a big decision.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gates Excitation: The guys do everything in their power to meet Bill Gates when his firm has dealings with the pharmaceutical company Penny works for.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: G.I. (Annoyed Grunt): Homer accidentally signs up for basic training in the army. And Marge and Grampa get roped in when they try to get him released.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe 'n' a Lisa: Lisa discovers Moe's poetic talent and helps get him published. And he's so successful that he - and the Simpsons - are invited to a literary conference.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Four Great Women and a Manicure: On a visit to the nail salon, Marge and Lisa discuss whether a woman can be simultaneously clever, powerful and beautiful.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner: A new amusement park ride transports the Simpsons to Kang and Kodos's home planet, where they're held captive in a zoo.

programme.title: Supercruising: Life at Sea
programme.desc: On the North Africa and Europe voyage, the chefs prepare a fine-dining experience with a difference, while the Caribbean cruisers enjoy tranquil bamboo rafting in the scorching heat. (Ep4)

programme.title: Oblivion

programme.title: Brussels, My Love?
programme.desc: From the economy to the climate and the EU's role in world affairs, this talk show sheds light on European affairs and the issues that impact on our daily lives as Europeans.

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: (1999) Drama with Tom Hanks and Michael Clarke Duncan. Strange events occur when a man convicted of raping and murdering two young girls arrives on death row in a Louisiana prison.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: (2003) Kevin Costner's western with Robert Duvall and Michael Gambon. A small band of free grazers are forced to take on a local rancher and his hired thugs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: (1953) Audrey Hepburn won her only Oscar in this romance as a bored princess who runs away from her duties and meets an American journalist (Gregory Peck), who shows her Rome.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Storm over the Nile
programme.desc: (1955) Drama. Anthony Steel stars as a disgraced soldier who, during the British army's 1898 campaign in Sudan, goes way beyond the call of duty to prove his courage. With Laurence Harvey.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: (2015) Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance star in Steven Spielberg's Cold War spy drama. After gaining notoriety for defending a Soviet spy, a US lawyer then tries to free a CIA pilot.

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: We're All Going to the World's...
programme.desc: ...Fair: (2021) Jane Schoenbrun's creepy, freaky, coming-of-age horror starring Anna Cobb. A lonely teenage girl gets increasingly sucked into the unnerving nether-world of an online game.

programme.title: Kill List
programme.desc: (2011) Horror. Neil Maskell and Michael Smiley star as friends whose latest job leads them into shockingly brutal, gory violence. With MyAnna Buring and Emma Fryer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: (1951) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a rancher who's the target of unwelcome harassment by his richer and more powerful neighbour. With Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.

programme.title: San Demetrio, London
programme.desc: (1943) Fact-based drama about a group of Merchant Navy sailors who brave fire and the ocean to save the San Demetrio oil tanker after it's almost destroyed by a German cruiser.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Bloodshot
programme.desc: (2020) Vin Diesel stars in this action-packed superhero adventure. After he and his wife are killed, a US soldier is brought back to life and given superhuman powers.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Saint Maud
programme.desc: (2019) Psychological horror. After failing to save a life, a nurse transforms her life and vows to save the godless soul of a terminally-ill atheist woman from an eternity with Satan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: (1957) Second World War thriller. Robert Mitchum stars as the captain of a US destroyer in the North Atlantic hunting down a German U-boat and its world-weary captain, Curt Jurgens.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fiancé. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: X
programme.desc: (2022) Ti West's acclaimed grindhouse horror with Mia Goth. Some adult filmmakers inexplicably choose a ramshackle house in the Bible-Belt wilderness to shoot a film. It's gonna get nasty.

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: (1999) Drama with Tom Hanks and Michael Clarke Duncan. Strange events occur when a man convicted of raping and murdering two young girls arrives on death row in a Louisiana prison.

programme.desc: (2022) Leaving from Platform 4 - a high octane, Shinkansen-set comedy thriller with Brad Pitt, Joey King and Michael Shannon. A jaded assassin does one last job on a villain-packed train.

programme.title: We're All Going to the World's...
programme.desc: ...Fair: (2021) Jane Schoenbrun's creepy, freaky, coming-of-age horror starring Anna Cobb. A lonely teenage girl gets increasingly sucked into the unnerving nether-world of an online game.

programme.title: Kill List
programme.desc: (2011) Horror. Neil Maskell and Michael Smiley star as friends whose latest job leads them into shockingly brutal, gory violence. With MyAnna Buring and Emma Fryer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: (1951) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a rancher who's the target of unwelcome harassment by his richer and more powerful neighbour. With Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew.

programme.title: San Demetrio, London
programme.desc: (1943) Fact-based drama about a group of Merchant Navy sailors who brave fire and the ocean to save the San Demetrio oil tanker after it's almost destroyed by a German cruiser.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: (1954) Western starring Dana Andrews. A man falsely accused of murder gets a last-minute reprieve from the lynch mob so he can track down the real culprit.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Bloodshot
programme.desc: (2020) Vin Diesel stars in this action-packed superhero adventure. After he and his wife are killed, a US soldier is brought back to life and given superhuman powers.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Saint Maud
programme.desc: (2019) Psychological horror. After failing to save a life, a nurse transforms her life and vows to save the godless soul of a terminally-ill atheist woman from an eternity with Satan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Carrington, VC
programme.desc: (1954) Anthony Asquith's vivid and subtle courtroom drama casts David Niven as the eponymous officer accused of stealing army money and going absent without leave.

programme.title: The Enemy Below
programme.desc: (1957) Second World War thriller. Robert Mitchum stars as the captain of a US destroyer in the North Atlantic hunting down a German U-boat and its world-weary captain, Curt Jurgens.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: (1954) Western with Robert Mitchum and Marilyn Monroe. An ex-con and a saloon singer steer a raft through hostile territory to face a showdown with her crooked fiancé. With Rory Calhoun.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?
